item.title: Report E-2024100727
item.description:
Report E-2024100727

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% FG release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 7’ area of the trailer floor. The tote was cracked on the tote corner due to improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a two new ones. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent. All impacted absorbents and tote pieces were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100657
item.description:
Report E-2024100657

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: ROCK RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 16, 2024. one (1) 2-gallon pail of Sikadur®-55 SLV Part B was crushed in transit and rel.eased approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizer, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal

item.title: Report E-2024100671
item.description:
Report E-2024100671

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: FORT DODGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver was completed with loading the driver failed to drain the hose before disconnecting from the source. This lead to the release of approximately 2 gallons of material into the containment. Crews were dispatched to clean up the material. The material was collected and disposed of in the proper manor.
